column1: A Secure Digital card (SD card) is a kind of memory card. Such cards are often used to store images or data in digital cameras. As of 2008
column2: different capacities between 4 Megabytes and 32 gigabytes have been made. The card has a rectangular design
column3: but one edge is chipped off. This means that the cards cannot be inserted into the cameras (or other devices) the wrong way.There are different kinds of cards:Those labeled SD
column4: with capacities up to 2 GBThose labeled SDHC
column5: with capacities between 4GB and 32GBThose labeled SDXC
column6: with capacities of up to 2 TB (largest made is currently 512GB or 200 GB for MicroSD).SD and SDHC are not compatible
column7: but devices that accept SDHC also accept SD cards. The interface of SDHC and SDXC cards is the same
column8: but SDXC uses a different file system. Some devices (for example the Wii) that originally shipped only with support for SD can be made to support SDHC with a firmware update.
